interventions.Card Title: Set Clear Boundaries and Time Limits
interventions.Card Description: '- **Example**: Use apps like "Screen Time" on iOS or "Digital Wellbeing" on Android to track and limit usage. Set specific hours for internet use, such as no internet after 9 PM.
'- **Example**: Make areas such as the bedroom or dining room tech-free zones to encourage activities like reading before bed or having family meals without devices.

interventions.Card Title: Create a Schedule for Internet Use
interventions.Card Description: '- **Example**: Establish a schedule where internet use is allowed only after completing certain tasks to prioritize work and other activities over online browsing.
'- **Example**: Commit to offline hobbies such as gardening, exercising, cooking, or attending local clubs or events to reduce reliance on the internet for entertainment.
'- **Example**: Spend one day a week without using the internet, focusing on mindfulness practices like meditation or journaling.

interventions.Card Title: Educate About the Risks of Internet Overuse
interventions.Card Description: '- **Example**: Attend workshops or watch documentaries about the physical and mental health risks of excessive internet use to increase awareness and motivation to cut back.
'- **Example**: Implement software that blocks distracting websites during work hours, like "Cold Turkey" or the "StayFocusd" browser extension.

interventions.Card Title: Get Support from Family and Friends
interventions.Card Description: '- **Example**: Involve family members or friends in your efforts by planning shared activities that donâ€™t involve screens and holding each other accountable for internet usage goals.
'- **Example**: Consult with a therapist or counselor specializing in internet addiction to develop strategies tailored to your needs and challenges.

'- **Example**: Spend time journaling or talking with a friend or counselor to understand what is driving excessive internet use, such as boredom, stress, or social pressures, and find healthier ways to address these issues.
